summary: The Pipeline Accountability Act of 2025 aims to enhance pipeline safety and environmental protection. It mandates the establishment of a Public Engagement Office within the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA) to improve public outreach and transparency. The bill also introduces new regulations for carbon dioxide pipelines, sets standards for rupture mitigation, and addresses the blending of hydrogen with natural gas. It modifies grant programs for natural gas infrastructure, and strengthens accountability measures, including penalties, regarding pipeline safety violations.
